term.title: gel aging

item.text: Time-dependent changes in the chemical or the physical structure and the properties of a gel.

notes.item: The aging of a gel can involve polymerization, crystallization, aggregation, syneresis, phase changes, formation of branch points and junction points as well as scission and chemical changes to constitutional units of network chains.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 1801. 'Definitions of terms relating to the structure and processing of sols, gels, networks, and inorganic-organic hybrid materials (IUPAC Recommendations 2007)' on page 1823 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779101801)

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
